issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
On iPhone when manage contacts via picker landscape mode leads to hiding part of contacts list.

This is not a regression it occurs on SDK 2.1.0.GA

Steps to reproduce:
1) Launch refactored Kitchen Sink (Kevin Winnerey/Developer relations version) > Phone > Contacts
2) â€¨Tap on 'Contacts picker' > 'Show picker' rotate the device to landscape mode.
3) From step 1 tap on 'Remove contact' > 'Delete via picker' rotate the device to landscape mode.
4) From step 1 tap on 'Contact images' > 'Get image from picker' or 'Remove image via picker' or 'Set image via picker' and rotate the device to landscape mode.
5) From step 1 tap on 'Groups' > 'Add person' or 'Remove person' and rotate the device to landscape mode. 

Actual result:
Part of contact list is hidden under status bar.

Expected result:
Part of contact list isn't hidden.
fields.summary: KitchenSink: Phone > Contacts: on iPhone in landscape mode part of contact list is hidden under status bar when manage contacts via picker
fields.environment:
iPhone4 (5.1), iPhone4s Sprint (5.1)
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.1.201207171343
SDK version: 2.1.1.v20120727140110

comments.body: Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer supported.
